intro: Trianthema glinoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandbur, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Trianthema glinoides is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in arid regions.
